name: snyk-vulnerability-scanner
//: Changing display name requires change in general.ts
description: Easily find and fix vulnerabilities in your code, open source dependencies, infrastructure as code configurations with fast and accurate scans.

snyk.yesCrashReport.//: Name starts with y to put it at the end, as configs are sorted alphbetically

snyk.yesWelcomeNotification.//: Name starts with y to put it at the end, as configs are sorted alphabetically
snyk.yesWelcomeNotification.markdownDescription: Show welcome notification after installation and restart

snyk.yesBackgroundOssNotification.//: Name starts with y to put it at the end, as configs are sorted alphabetically
snyk.yesBackgroundOssNotification.markdownDescription: Show scan notification for critical Open Source Security vulnerabilities when Snyk view is hidden

snyk.advanced.autoScanOpenSourceSecurity.description: Run Snyk Open Source Security vulnerability analysis in automatic mode.

enumDescriptions: Do not scan automatically, only scan when you run the `Snyk: Rescan` command.
snyk.scanningMode.title: Snyk Code scanning mode
snyk.scanningMode.description: Choose whether to run Snyk Code scans in the background, or only when you run the `Snyk: Rescan` command.

snyk.advanced.additionalParameters.description: Parameters to pass to Snyk CLI for Open Source security tests.

snyk.advanced.customEndpoint.markdownDescription: Sets API endpoint to use for Snyk requests. Useful for custom Snyk setups. E.g. `https://app.eu.snyk.io/api`.

snyk.advanced.organization.markdownDescription:
Specifies an organization slug name to run tests for that organization. 

Note: The slug name can be extracted from the URL of your organization in the Snyk UI: `https://app.snyk.io/org/[orgslugname]`. If not specified, preferred organization as defined in your [web account settings](https://app.snyk.io/account) is used to run tests.

enum: Always use VS Code's secret storage
snyk.advanced.tokenStorage.default: Always use VS Code's secret storage
snyk.advanced.tokenStorage.markdownDescription: Snyk uses VS Code's [secret storage](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#SecretStorage) to safely persist API token instead of saving it in plaintext in `settings.json`. To set the token manually, run the VS Code command [Snyk: Set Token](command:snyk.setToken).

snyk.advanced.automaticDependencyManagem.markdownDescription: Snyk will download, install and update dependencies for you. If this option is disabled, make sure valid paths to the dependencies are provided.

snyk.advanced.cliPath.markdownDescription: Sets path to Snyk CLI extension dependency.

snyk.advanced.languageServerPath.markdownDescription: Sets path to Snyk Language Server (requires restart).

snyk.features.openSourceSecurity.title: Snyk Open Source security issues
snyk.features.openSourceSecurity.description: Find and fix open source vulnerabilities.

snyk.features.codeSecurity.title: Snyk Code security issues
snyk.features.codeSecurity.description: Find and fix vulnerabilities in your application code in real time.

snyk.features.codeQuality.title: Snyk Code quality issues
snyk.features.codeQuality.description: Find and fix code quality issues in your application code in real time.

snyk.features.infrastructureAsCode.title: Snyk Infrastructure as Code issues
snyk.features.infrastructureAsCode.description: Find and fix your IaC misconfigurations.

snyk.trustedFolders.description: Folders to trust for Snyk scans.

snyk.features.preview.title: Preview feature toggles
snyk.features.preview.description: Preview features that are currently in development. Setting keys will be removed when features become stable.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Snyk has encountered a problem. Please restart the extension: 
[Restart](command:snyk.start 'Restart Snyk')
If the error persists, please check your [settings](command:snyk.settings) and [contact us](https://snyk.io/contact-us/?utm_source=vsc)!

üëã Welcome to Snyk for Visual Studio Code. 
‚è±Ô∏è Please wait, the extension is loading...

üëã Welcome to Snyk for Visual Studio Code. 
üëâ Connect with Snyk to start your first analysis!
When scanning folder files, Snyk may automatically execute code such as invoking the package manager to get dependency information. You should only scan projects you trust. [More info](https://docs.snyk.io/ide-tools/visual-studio-code-extension/workspace-trust)
[Trust workspace and connect](command:snyk.initiateLogin 'Connect with Snyk')
By connecting your account with Snyk, you agree to the Snyk [Privacy Policy](https://snyk.io/policies/privacy), and the Snyk [Terms of Service](https://snyk.io/policies/terms-of-service).

We are now redirecting you to our auth page, go ahead and log in. If a browser window doesn't open after a few seconds, please copy the url below and manually paste it in a browser.
[Copy URL to clipboard](command:snyk.copyAuthLink 'Copy URL to clipboard')

Thanks for connecting with Snyk. ‚úÖ
 üëâ You are almost set ü§ó.
[Enable Snyk Code and start analysing](command:snyk.enableCode 'Upload code to Snyk')
It looks like your organization's configuration is disabled, that's why you are seeing this message. You can easily enable it by pressing the above button and switching it on.
We apologize for the inconvenience and please [contact us](https://snyk.io/contact-us/?utm_source=vsc) if you have any other questions or concerns!
Open a workspace or a folder in Visual Studio Code to start the analysis.

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build
